patch 7.4.1601
Problem:    README files take a lot of space in the top directory.
Solution:   Move most of them to "READMEdir".

attachments.fallback:
patch 7.4.1603
Problem:    Timer with an ":echo" command messes up display.
Solution:   Redraw depending on the mode. (Hirohito Higashi)  Avoid the more
            prompt being used recursively.
attachments.title: patch 7.4.1603
attachments.text:
patch 7.4.1603
Problem:    Timer with an ":echo" command messes up display.
Solution:   Redraw depending on the mode. (Hirohito Higashi)  Avoid the more
            prompt being used recursively.

attachments.fallback:
patch 7.4.1604
Problem:    Although emoji characters are ambiguous width, best is to treat
            them as full width.
Solution:   Update the Unicode character tables. Add the 'emoji' options.
            (Yasuhiro Matsumoto)
attachments.title: patch 7.4.1604
attachments.text:
patch 7.4.1604
Problem:    Although emoji characters are ambiguous width, best is to treat
            them as full width.
Solution:   Update the Unicode character tables. Add the 'emoji' options.
            (Yasuhiro Matsumoto)

attachments.fallback:
patch 7.4.1605
Problem:    Catching exception that won't be thrown.
Solution:   Remove try/catch.
attachments.title: patch 7.4.1605
attachments.text:
patch 7.4.1605
Problem:    Catching exception that won't be thrown.
Solution:   Remove try/catch.

attachments.fallback:
patch 7.4.1606
Problem:    Having type() handle a Funcref that is or isn't a partial
            differently causes problems for existing scripts.
Solution:   Make type() return the same value. (Thinca)
attachments.title: patch 7.4.1606
attachments.text:
patch 7.4.1606
Problem:    Having type() handle a Funcref that is or isn't a partial
            differently causes problems for existing scripts.
Solution:   Make type() return the same value. (Thinca)

attachments.fallback:
patch 7.4.1607
Problem:    Comparing a function that exists on two dicts is not backwards
            compatible. (Thinca)
Solution:   Only compare the function, not what the partial adds.
attachments.title: patch 7.4.1607
attachments.text:
patch 7.4.1607
Problem:    Comparing a function that exists on two dicts is not backwards
            compatible. (Thinca)
Solution:   Only compare the function, not what the partial adds.

attachments.fallback:
patch 7.4.1608
Problem:    string() doesn't handle a partial.
Solution:   Make a string from a partial.
attachments.title: patch 7.4.1608
attachments.text:
patch 7.4.1608
Problem:    string() doesn't handle a partial.
Solution:   Make a string from a partial.

patch 7.4.1610
Problem:    Compiler warnings for non-virtual destructor.
Solution:   Mark the classe final. (Ken Takata)

attachments.text:
patch 7.4.1610
Problem:    Compiler warnings for non-virtual destructor.
Solution:   Mark the classe final. (Ken Takata)

attachments.fallback:
patch 7.4.1611
Problem:    The versplit feature makes the code uneccessary complicated.
Solution:   Remove FEAT_VERTSPLIT, always support vertical splits when
            FEAT_WINDOWS is defined.
attachments.title: patch 7.4.1611
attachments.text:
patch 7.4.1611
Problem:    The versplit feature makes the code uneccessary complicated.
Solution:   Remove FEAT_VERTSPLIT, always support vertical splits when
            FEAT_WINDOWS is defined.
